description: Invertible Boolean functions of n variables.
comments: Equivalence classes of invertible maps from {0,1}^n to {0,1}^n, under action of (C_2)^n on domain and permutation of variables on range. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Mar 15 2011
references: M. A. Harrison, The number of classes of invertible Boolean functions, J. ACM 10 (1963), 25-28.
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8
M. A. Harrison, The number of classes of invertible Boolean functions, J. ACM 10 (1963), 25-28. [Annotated scan of page 27 only]
Index entries for sequences related to Boolean functions
mathematica: f[n_] := (2^n - 1)!/n!; Array[f, 6] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 14 2011 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from _Sean A. Irvine_, Mar 14 2011
